1.text: Paul and Timotheus, the servants of Jesus Christ, to all the saints in Christ Jesus which are at Philippi, with the bishops and deacons:

2.text: Grace be to you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

3.text: I thank my God on every remembrance of you,

4.text: Always in every prayer of my for you all making request with joy,

5.text: For your fellowship in the gospel from the first day until now;

6.text: Being confident of this very thing, that he which has begun a good work in you will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ:

7.text: Even as it is meet for me to think this of you all, because I have you in my heart; inasmuch as both in my bonds, and in the defense and confirmation of the gospel, you all are partakers of my grace.

8.text: For God is my record, how greatly I long after you all in the bowels of Jesus Christ.

9.text: And this I pray, that your love may abound yet more and more in knowledge and in all judgment;

10.text: That you may approve things that are excellent; that you may be sincere and without offense till the day of Christ.

11.text: Being filled with the fruits of righteousness, which are by Jesus Christ, to the glory and praise of God.

12.text: But I would you should understand, brothers, that the things which happened to me have fallen out rather to the furtherance of the gospel;

13.text: So that my bonds in Christ are manifest in all the palace, and in all other places;

14.text: And many of the brothers in the Lord, waxing confident by my bonds, are much more bold to speak the word without fear.

15.text: Some indeed preach Christ even of envy and strife; and some also of good will:

16.text: The one preach Christ of contention, not sincerely, supposing to add affliction to my bonds:

17.text: But the other of love, knowing that I am set for the defense of the gospel.

18.text: What then? notwithstanding, every way, whether in pretense, or in truth, Christ is preached; and I therein do rejoice, yes, and will rejoice.

19.text: For I know that this shall turn to my salvation through your prayer, and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ,

20.text: According to my earnest expectation and my hope, that in nothing I shall be ashamed, but that with all boldness, as always, so now also Christ shall be magnified in my body, whether it be by life, or by death.

21.text: For to me to live is Christ, and to die is gain.

22.text: But if I live in the flesh, this is the fruit of my labor: yet what I shall choose I know not.

23.text: For I am in a strait between two, having a desire to depart, and to be with Christ; which is far better:

24.text: Nevertheless to abide in the flesh is more needful for you.

25.text: And having this confidence, I know that I shall abide and continue with you all for your furtherance and joy of faith;

26.text: That your rejoicing may be more abundant in Jesus Christ for me by my coming to you again.

27.text: Only let your conversation be as it becomes the gospel of Christ: that whether I come and see you, or else be absent, I may hear of your affairs, that you stand fast in one spirit, with one mind striving together for the faith of the gospel;

28.text: And in nothing terrified by your adversaries: which is to them an evident token of perdition, but to you of salvation, and that of God.

29.text: For to you it is given in the behalf of Christ, not only to believe on him, but also to suffer for his sake;

30.text: Having the same conflict which you saw in me, and now hear to be in me.
